front.title: Non PHP Behavior and out-of-band mapping for RSVP-TE LSPs

abstract.t: Expires December 2008 [page 1] Internet-Draft draft-ietf-mpls-rsvp-te-no-php-oob-mapping-01.txt There are many deployment scenarios which require Egress LSR to receive binding of the RSVP-TE LSP to an application, and payload identification, using some "out-of-band" (OOB) mechanism. This document proposes protocol mechanisms to address this requirement. The procedures described in this document are equally applicable for point-to-point (P2P) and point-to- multipoint (P2MP) LSPs. Conventions used in this document In examples, "C:" and "S:" indicate lines sent by the client and server respectively.
